channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 突发事件俄罗斯当局称，莫斯科地区的一个音乐会场发生爆炸，枪手向剧院观众开火。遇难者人数不详。
item.description:
Breaking: An explosion rocked a concert venue in the Moscow region and gunmen opened fire on theatergoers, Russian authorities said. The number of victims was unclear. https://t.co/KIqqXXbao0 https://t.co/KIqqXXbao0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 观看：威尔士王妃凯特-米德尔顿表示，1 月份的腹部手术显示她患有癌症，目前她正在接受预防性化疗。
item.description:
Watch: Kate Middleton, the Princess of Wales, said abdominal surgery in January revealed that she had cancer and she is currently undergoing preventative chemotherapy https://t.co/bjYA6dIxUw https://t.co/bjYA6dIxUw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 印度主要反对党称，在税务机关冻结其账户并扣押其资金后，该党的竞选活动陷入困境
item.description:
India’s main opposition party says its campaign is in tatters after tax authorities froze its accounts and seized its funds https://t.co/uaQK212837 https://t.co/uaQK212837

item.title: 微策略公司（MicroStrategy）拥有 140 亿美元的比特币，其他的并不多。为什么这家公司价值 330 亿美元？
item.description:
MicroStrategy owns $14 billion of bitcoin—and not much else. Why is the company worth $33 billion? https://t.co/AJ9PLCcYDK https://t.co/AJ9PLCcYDK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 最新消息威尔士王妃凯特-米德尔顿（Kate Middleton）宣布她正在接受癌症治疗，癌症是在 1 月份的腹部手术后发现的
item.description:
Breaking: Kate Middleton, Princess of Wales, announced that she is undergoing treatment for cancer, which was discovered after abdominal surgery in January https://t.co/KUfIBjM4Hv https://t.co/KUfIBjM4Hv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: "可被他人发现"？苹果公司默认开启了一个听起来令人毛骨悚然的 iPhone 设置，导致许多人认为他们的信息在不知情或未经同意的情况下被共享了。以下是为什么它并不可怕--以及如何关闭它。
item.description:
“Discoverable by Others”? Apple turned a creepy-sounding iPhone setting on by default, leading many to think their information is being shared without their knowledge or consent. Here’s why it’s not so scary—and how to turn it off. https://t.co/z5s5n16QQt https://t.co/z5s5n16QQt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 克莱斯勒母公司 Stellantis 将在美国裁员数百人。

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：任何只关注以色列西南部加沙的人都忽略了一半。@ElliotKaufman6写道：北部的战争可能使加沙之战相形见绌，并永远改变黎巴嫩和以色列。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Anyone focused only on Gaza, to Israel’s southwest, is missing half the story. War in the north could dwarf the Gaza fight and change Lebanon and Israel forever, writes @ElliotKaufman6. https://t.co/H2wvpI9K78

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: Bee Wilson 写道：从胡萝卜蛋糕到 spanakopita，重塑经典菜肴有助于保持其生命力。
item.description:
From carrot cake to spanakopita, reinventing classic dishes helps keep them alive, writes Bee Wilson https://t.co/bJLkR4pwuZ https://t.co/bJLkR4pwuZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 看：Neuralink 只是脑芯片新兴市场中的一个参与者，这些设备可以帮助人们通过心灵感应控制电脑等。华尔街日报》走进脑部手术室，了解植入物的工作原理。
item.description:
Watch: Neuralink is just one player in an emerging market for brain chips, devices that help people telepathically control computers and more. WSJ goes inside a brain surgery to see how the implants work. https://t.co/gGty6PnYux https://t.co/gGty6PnYux

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 人们深知失去亲人的悲痛。但是，人们对慢性疾病带来的悲痛却不甚了解。
item.description:
People are well aware of the grief that comes with losing a loved one. But less well understood is the grief that comes with chronic illness. https://t.co/I6JjqwKzjm https://t.co/I6JjqwKzjm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：独立中央银行的论点是，我们普通公民需要明智的技术官僚来把我们从不良冲动中拯救出来。@josephsternberg 写道：事实证明，情况几乎恰恰相反。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The argument for independent central banking was that we regular citizens require wise technocrats to save us from our bad impulses. Reality is proving to be almost exactly the opposite, writes @josephsternberg. https://t.co/Jbidfud8DN

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 突发事件：众议院立法者以微弱优势通过了1.2万亿美元的一揽子支出法案，克服了保守派后期提出的阻挠要求
item.description:
Breaking: House lawmakers narrowly approved a $1.2 trillion package of spending bills, overcoming a late charge by conservatives to block the effort https://t.co/PbQDMjt2bZ https://t.co/PbQDMjt2bZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 即使在最著名的制造商破产之后，电动滑板行业的未来仍然看起来快速而有趣。感谢 Reddit。
item.description:
Even after the bankruptcy of its most prominent manufacturer, the electric skateboard industry's future looks fast and fun. Thanks Reddit. https://t.co/6Keb1i8o8c https://t.co/6Keb1i8o8c

item.title: 据报道，世界各地的女性对自己的生活比男性更苦恼，也更满意。华尔街日报》的 @EmilyBobrow 提问：这是怎么回事？
item.description:
Women around the world report being both more distressed and more satisfied with their lives than men. WSJ's @EmilyBobrow asks, what’s going on? https://t.co/ObfIfsdbQW https://t.co/ObfIfsdbQW

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 最新消息投资者批准了将唐纳德-特朗普陷入困境的社交媒体公司上市的计划，这使他距离获得约 30 亿美元的意外之财又近了一步
item.description:

item.title: 要想知道哪位候选人将赢得总统大选，请使用政治分析家杰夫-格林菲尔德的预测模型：竞选中的兔八哥总能打败达菲鸭
item.description:
To figure out which candidate will win the presidential election, use political analyst Jeff Greenfield’s prediction model: The Bugs Bunny of the race always beats the Daffy Duck https://t.co/tTBoz6kRsK https://t.co/tTBoz6kRsK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：司法部对苹果公司的诉讼试图强迫修改国会尚未通过的反垄断法，而所谓的消费者利益并不明显

item.title: "这在曼彻斯特有点不寻常"在马萨诸塞州的海岸边，一栋现代风格的住宅正以 900 万美元的价格在市场上出售。
item.description:

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 众议院立法者预计将于周五就 1.2 万亿美元的一揽子支出法案进行投票，然后将该法案送交参议院，国会将努力在午夜截止日期前敲定 9 月份的联邦拨款。
item.description:
House lawmakers are expected to vote Friday on a $1.2 trillion package of spending bills and then send the measure to the Senate, as Congress works to finalize federal funding through September by a midnight deadline https://t.co/aRSKOgUmJd https://t.co/aRSKOgUmJd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）将俄罗斯的炮击与西方盟国的援助延迟联系在一起，俄罗斯的炮击导致乌克兰数十万人停电，这是今年对能源基础设施造成的最严重的破坏性袭击。
item.description:
A Russian barrage left hundreds of thousands of people without power in Ukraine in the most damaging attack this year on energy infrastructure, which President Volodymyr Zelensky linked to delays in aid from Western allies https://t.co/ySoesKaupz https://t.co/ySoesKaupz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 多年来，中国新一代中产阶级认为经济繁荣是理所当然的。他们日趋紧张的情绪可能会成为中国政府的一大难题。
item.description:
For years, China’s new generation of middle class were able to take a booming economy for granted. Their increasing nervousness could be a major problem for Beijing. https://t.co/pt4QFrDqhp https://t.co/pt4QFrDqhp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: "要么你结束这一切，要么我走人"在华盛顿特区的一个富人区，一桩少棒丑闻让位高权重的家长们相互对立，并导致了一项发现。
item.description:

item.title: 奥克兰大学六年级学生杰克-高尔克（Jack Gohlke）是大学篮球队中三分球命中率最高的球员。周四晚上，他的这一做法收到了成效，在 NCAA 锦标赛中首次爆出大冷门。
item.description:
Oakland sixth-year senior Jack Gohlke shoots the highest rate of 3-pointers in college basketball. Thursday night, the approach paid off with the NCAA tournament’s first major upset. https://t.co/5MeHxFJ4sm https://t.co/5MeHxFJ4sm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 大谷翔平在道奇队的首秀并不尽如人意。@JasonGay：关于这位明星球员的翻译卷入赌博的指控--以及随着各联盟继续拥抱博彩业，这意味着什么。
item.description:
This wasn’t the debut Shohei Ohtani imagined with the Dodgers. @JasonGay on the gambling allegations involving the star ballplayer’s interpreter—and what it means as leagues continue to embrace the business of betting. https://t.co/EmWRHdaAp2 https://t.co/EmWRHdaAp2
